sources.title: Along Came Love
sources.description: Title: Along Came Love Summary: The shop girl Emmy Grant meets the handsome doorman John Patrick O'Ryan outside of a theater and she is convinced that he is her true love. O'Ryan is a zealous medical student, soon to be a... Directed by: Bert Lytell Actors: Irene Hervey, Charles Starrett, Doris Kenyon Production Company: Richard A. Rowland Productions Release Date: 6 November 1936 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Color: Black and White The shop girl Emmy Grant meets the handsome doorman John Patrick O'Ryan outside of a theater and she is convinced that he is her true love. O'Ryan is a zealous medical student, soon to be a pediatrician, and is oblivious to Emmy's frantic attempts to gain his attention. O'Ryan is totally focused on babies. Undaunted, she 'borrows' a baby and a buggy, determined to catch O'Ryan.

metadata.Plot: The shop girl Emmy Grant meets the handsome doorman John Patrick O'Ryan outside of a theater and she is convinced that he is her true love. O'Ryan is a zealous medical student, soon to be a pediatrician, and is oblivious to Emmy's frantic attempts to gain his attention. O'Ryan is totally focused on babies. Undaunted, she 'borrows' a baby and a buggy, determined to catch O'Ryan.
metadata.Actors: Irene Hervey, Charles Starrett, Doris Kenyon
